The Dow Jones industrial average climbed more than 22 percent in 1986, reaching a record of 1,955.57 on Dec. 2.
New York Stock Exchange issues overall advanced more than 13 percent. An article begins on Page

D1, followed by a special report on pages D5 to D10 on the stocks that fared the best and worst in 1986. Included are full-year stock tables for the New York Stock Exchange, the American Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq National Market.
The tables show the highest and lowest quotations for each stock, year-end prices and the percentage change from 1985.
